result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Gene Reed

Defendant Joel Gene Reed appeared by video.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi appeared by video for Joel Gene Reed.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Court orders case adjourned for status conference, Branch 15 by Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel Gene Reed
Current: 302 Washington, Oconto Falls, WI 54154 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 4188 County Road C, Unit C, Pulaski, WI 54162

Defendant Joel Gene Reed in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 15 for a Pretrial Conference.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/23/22 @ 2p
